title: 110_s2543
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" is cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" introduces new laws regarding the transportation of minors across state lines for abortions, specifically targeting the abridgement of parental rights. Offenders face fines or imprisonment for knowingly facilitating such actions. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits minors from getting abortions in a different state without parental consent, except in cases where the minor's life is in danger due to pregnancy. Transporting a minor for abortion without consent is also prohibited, with no prosecution for the minor or parent involved. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits minors from obtaining abortions in another state without parental consent. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed that parental consent or notification had occurred as required by the law in the minor's state of residence. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits minors from obtaining abortions in another state without parental consent. A court in the minor's state of residence must waive parental notification or authorize the minor to procure an abortion. Parents can seek civil action for harm caused by a violation of the Act, except in cases of incest. The term 'abortion' is defined as the intentional termination of pregnancy. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits minors from obtaining abortions in another state without parental consent, except in cases of incest. It defines abortion as the intentional termination of pregnancy and includes provisions for parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. This involvement may require notification or consent from a parent, or proceedings in a State court. The term 'minor' refers to an individual younger than the age requiring parental notification or consent for abortion. The term 'parent' includes a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or person standing in loco parentis. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia. Sec. 2432 prohibits the transportation of minors across state lines for abortion after committing incest. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia and any other US territory. The table of chapters in title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new item related to transportation of minors in circumvention of laws relating to abortion.
